timeSeries.long_name: Unique identifier for each feature instance

TIME_TEMP.comment: This is the time at which temperature information is sampled

WPFM.long_name: sea surface wave spectral mean period
WPFM.comment: The first wave period is calculated as m0/m1 where m0 and m1 are the zeroth order and first order moments of the wave spectrum

WPPE.comment: Period of the peak of the energy spectrum

SSWMD.long_name: spectral sea surface wave mean direction
SSWMD.comment: Direction (related to the true north direct from instrument) from which the mean period waves are coming from

WPDI.comment: Direction (related to the true north direct from instrument) from which the peak period waves are coming from

WMDS.long_name: spectral sea surface wave mean directional spread

WPDS.long_name: spectral sea surface wave peak directional spread

WSSH.long_name: sea surface wave spectral significant height

TEMP.long_name: sea water temperature at sea surface
TEMP.method: Measured using thermistor embedded in wave buoy hull
TEMP.comment: Temperature measurements of available temperature sensors. If instrument (see instrument global attribute in this netcdf) is Spotter-VX, this variable refers to a hull-mounted sensor (i.e. surface measurements). If instrument is Spotter Smart-Mooring, this variable refers to a 1 meter depth mooring sensor.

WAVE_quality_control.long_name: primary Quality Control flag for wave variables
WAVE_quality_control.quality_control_convention: Ocean Data Standards, UNESCO 2013 - IOC Manuals and Guides, 54, Volume 3 Version 1

TEMP_quality_control.long_name: primary Quality Control flag for temperature variable
TEMP_quality_control.quality_control_convention: Ocean Data Standards, UNESCO 2013 - IOC Manuals and Guides, 54, Volume 3 Version 1

general_attributes.title: Near real time integral wave parameters from wave buoys collected by {institution} using a {instrument} at {site_name}
general_attributes.abstract: Near real time integral wave parameters from wave buoys collected by {institution} using a {instrument} at {site_name}
general_attributes.author: {author}
general_attributes.standard_name_vocabulary: NetCDF Climate and Forecast CF Standard Name Table Version 78
general_attributes.history: this file was file created on: {time_coverage_end}
general_attributes.citation: The citation to be used in publications using the dataset should follow the format: "Integrated Marine Observing System, [year-of-data-downloaded], Wave buoys Observations - Australia - near real-time, Downloaded from [url] on [date-of-download]"
general_attributes.acknowledgement: Any users of IMOS data are required to clearly acknowledge the source of the material in the format: \"Data was sourced from Australiaâ€™s Integrated Marine Observing System (IMOS) - IMOS is enabled by the National Collaborative Research Infrastructure Strategy (NCRIS)\". This wave data was collected and quality controlled by the University of Western Australia. This dataset is an output from the Catching Oz Waves project, which received investment (https://doi.org/10.47486/DP748) from the Australian Research Data Commons (ARDC). The ARDC is funded by the National Collaborative Research Infrastructure Strategy (NCRIS).
general_attributes.disclaimer: Data, products and services from UWA are provided \"as is\" without any warranty as to fitness for a particular purpose.
